summary: Over the 6‑hour window wind conditions were very light (mean ~1.21 m/s, max 5.2 m/s) and power production remained essentially zero with very low variability (power mean ~-0.0015, std ~0.0003), though the power residual showed a consistent positive bias (~0.168). Pitch was steady (~24°) and ambient temperature around 24.4°C with no non‑normal status flags. Rotational signals were unusual in that rotor speed showed no variability (std=0) while generator speed varied substantially (std ~13.2 rpm), and yaw angle exhibited a large, persistent misalignment (~76.6°).
